Description: A string of spherical beads: made from diorite which is mostly white mottled with black.
Curator's comments: Lucas, in ‘Ancient Egyptian Materials and Industries’, 4th ed. (London, 1962), mentions that diorite which is 'white, slightly flecked with black' was 'much employed ... especially during the Fourth Dynasty'.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (227)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs Essie Winifred Newberry
